conclusion: Analyze the graph in Figure 2 to find the coefficient of kinetic friction and mass of A.
Graph shows relationship between force F applied to A and acceleration a of A.
When F = 60 N, a = 8 m/s². Use F = ma to find mass of A.
Calculate mass of A: m_A = 60 N / 8 m/s² = 7.5 kg.
When force F is large enough, acceleration of A no longer increases, indicating maximum kinetic friction.
Calculate force of kinetic friction: F_k = m_A * a = 7.5 kg * 8 m/s² = 60 N.
Calculate coefficient of kinetic friction: μ_k = F_k / (m_A * g) = 60 N / (7.5 kg * 10 m/s²) = 0.8.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is 0.8, and mass of A is 7.5 kg.
